item.title: Free Cell Phones Galore
item.description:
I’m looking at 26 different cell phones offered by major carriers like AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, and Verizon. They vary in model and price, but they all have one key thing in common: they’re free. You might think these are just outdated phones that no one wants, but that’s not the case. For example, there are several BlackBerry models available for free with a new AT&T wireless plan at standard rates. These include the BlackBerry Bold 9700 Black, BlackBerry Curve 8520 Black, and BlackBerry Curve 8900 Silver...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/free-cell-phones-galore/

item.title: Less expensive smartphones are available for those in developing markets
item.description:
To prepare for future growth, smartphone manufacturers are looking beyond China to other emerging markets. Although China represented a third of global smartphone shipments in 2013, the International Data Corporation (IDC) indicates this market is reaching its saturation point. IDC reports that smartphones constitute over 80% of China’s total phone sales. Consequently, they predict that India and Africa will be the primary sources of the next half billion smartphone customers...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/less-expensive-smartphones-are-available-for-those-in-developing-markets/
